qas.question: What was the mission of Keeping America's Promise?

answers.text: "A Democratic Congress will restore accountability to Washington and help change a disastrous course in Iraq"

qas.question: How many down-ballot candidates did Kerry help support?
How many states' down-ballot candidates did Kerry help support?
Which election did Kerry's PAC focus on?

answers.text: the midterm elections during the 2006 election cycle

context: Kerry established a separate political action committee, <a0_0>Keeping America's Promise<a0_0/>, which declared as its mandate <a1_0>"A Democratic Congress will restore accountability to Washington and help change a disastrous course in Iraq"<a1_0/>, and raised money and channeled contributions to Democratic candidates in state and federal races. Through Keeping America's Promise in 2005, Kerry raised over $5.5 million for other Democrats up and down the ballot. Through his campaign account and his political action committee, the Kerry campaign operation generated more than $10 million for various party committees and <a2_0>179<a2_0/> candidates for the U.S. House, Senate, state and local offices in <a3_0>42<a3_0/> states focusing on <a4_0>the midterm elections during the 2006 election cycle<a4_0/>. "Cumulatively, John Kerry has done as much if not more than any other individual senator", Hassan Nemazee, the national finance chairman of the DSCC said.
